docs.snippet: Even as petroleum prices plummet and the kingdom burns through its financial reserves, the Saudis are betting they can win an oil war of attrition....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even as petroleum prices plummet and the kingdom burns through its financial reserves, the Saudis are betting they can win an oil war of attrition.
docs.abstract: Saudi Arabia has continued to produce oil at almost full capacity and has persuaded its OPEC allies in Persian Gulf to behave similarly, even in face of dropping oil prices due to global glut; strategy is very risky, and relies on Saudi confidence that it can win oil-price war of attrition.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Keeps Pumping Oil, Despite Financial and Political Risks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

docs.snippet: War crimes prosecutors accused ex-Ivorian president Laurent Gbagbo of orchestrating "unspeakable violence", including murder and gang rape, to cling to power after losing an election, pitching his country into civil war....
docs.lead_paragraph: War crimes prosecutors accused ex-Ivorian president Laurent Gbagbo of orchestrating "unspeakable violence", including murder and gang rape, to cling to power after losing an election, pitching his country into civil war.

headline.main: Ivorian Ex-President on Trial Over 'Unspeakable Violence'

docs.snippet: A U.N. panel recommended Wednesday that cargo shipments of rechargeable lithium batteries be banned from passenger airliners because the batteries can create fires capable of destroying planes, said aviation officials familiar with the decision....

headline.main: AP Sources: Panel Proposes Ban on Air Shipments of Batteries
headline.print_headline: AP Sources: Panel Proposes Ban on Air Shipments of Batteries

docs.snippet: Japanese stocks were lower Thursday after the country's central bank introduced a negative rate interest policy that could boost the economy but also hurt earnings of major banks. The yen dived. Other Asian markets were mostly higher after China's...
docs.lead_paragraph: Japanese stocks were lower Thursday after the country's central bank introduced a negative rate interest policy that could boost the economy but also hurt earnings of major banks. The yen dived. Other Asian markets were mostly higher after China's top economy official said there is no basis for the yuan to continuously weaken.

headline.main: Japan Stocks Down Despite BOJ Move, Other Markets Gain
headline.print_headline: Japan Stocks Down Despite BOJ Move, Other Markets Gain

docs.snippet: The secretary of state, in Beijing, warned that if necessary, the United States would take security steps China’s leaders have strongly opposed....
docs.lead_paragraph: The secretary of state, in Beijing, warned that if necessary, the United States would take security steps China’s leaders have strongly opposed.
docs.abstract: Sec of State John Kerry tells Chinese foreign minister United States will take necessary steps to defend itself from long-range nuclear weapon North Korea is reportedly developing; warns reluctant Chinese leaders to rein in their neighbor or accept American actions, including installation of missile defense system in South Korea.

headline.main: John Kerry Urges China to Curb North Korea’s Nuclear Pursuits
headline.print_headline: Kerry Urges Chinese to Curb North Korea’s Expanding Nuclear Pursuits

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea
byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and DAVID E. SANGER

docs.snippet: The son-in-law of Vladimir Putin stands to benefit from $1.75 billion in cheap finance from the Russian state, a Reuters examination of public documents shows. The money will help fund a petrochemical project at a company in which Kirill Shamalov,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The son-in-law of Vladimir Putin stands to benefit from $1.75 billion in cheap finance from the Russian state, a Reuters examination of public documents shows. The money will help fund a petrochemical project at a company in which Kirill Shamalov, husband of Katerina Tikhonova, the Russian president's younger daughter, has a significant interest.

headline.main: Putin's Son-In-Law Boosted by $1.75 Billion Russian State Loan
headline.print_headline: Putin's Son-In-Law Boosted by $1.75 Billion Russian State Loan

headline.main: My Take on the Republican Debate, Minus Trump

docs.snippet: The reappointment of Nguyen Phu Trong is unlikely to alter the country’s strategic balance in relations with China and the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: The reappointment of Nguyen Phu Trong is unlikely to alter the country’s strategic balance in relations with China and the United States.
docs.abstract: Communist Party of Vietnam reappoints Nguyen Phu Trong, incumbent general secretary, to second five-year term; experts expect leader, member of party's old guard, to maintain close ties with China while seeking to increase cooperation with United States; compliance with recent US-sponsored Pacific Rim trade agreement will require opening of country's economy.

headline.main: Vietnam’s Communist Party Gives Old-Guard Leader a New 5-Year Term
headline.print_headline: New Term for Leader in Vietnam
